STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 22, 2024
Jeremy Mulvany
Eaton County Youth Facility – Community Based Treatment
822 Courthouse Drive
Charlotte, MI 48813-1069
RE: License #: CO230289991 – Renewal Inspection
Dear Jeremy Mulvany:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 02/14/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• None at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultant will tour Eaton County Youth Facility - Community Based Treatment
prior to the reopening of the program and admission of youths.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency was not required to submit a corrective action plan during this
inspection period.
Financial Overview
Review of Eaton County budget report shows Eaton County Youth Facility –
Community Based Treatment has adequate funding.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator is in the process of hiring staff to restart Eaton County Youth
Facility – Community Based Treatment program.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Eaton County Youth Facility – Community Based Treatment program is not
currently in operation, which results in no staff or youth to interview.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Eaton County Youth Facility - Community Based Treatment is in the same building
as Eaton County Detention. Eaton County Youth Facility – Community Based
Treatment has not serviced youths since 08/2021. The youth bedrooms are not
currently utilized, but the common area is currently used as a multipurpose room.
Chief administrator stated bedrooms and common area will be reconfigured prior
to the restart of the program.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
02/16/2024
